info.title: SuperCard APIs for Issuer
info.description: This contains apis to find supercards and to update the status of the cards.

post.summary: Update Card, This API is a request to update the card status
post.description: Update Card, This API is a request to update the card status
This event is published when the card is updated under topic _tenant_{{tenantId}}_CPRD.

post.summary:
List cards by filters. This API is a request to get the list of cards.
Pagination Rules:
Pagination is supported only when a single filter is applied.
If multiple filters are included in the request, pagination is not supported.
Exception: For account filter, pagination is never supported, regardless of the number of filters.
post.description:
List cards by filters. This API is a request to get the list of cards.
Pagination Rules:
Pagination is supported only when a single filter is applied.
If multiple filters are included in the request, pagination is not supported.
Exception: For account filter, pagination is never supported, regardless of the number of filters.

CardValidationDetails.description: This contains the card details for validation.

view.description:
This is the view of the response record. It can be any one of the following views: 
 - BASIC - This view provides basic information about the card like card ID, masked Primary Account Number (PAN) of the card, status, etc. 
 - EXPANDED - This view provides information of the basic view and extra information about the card order. 
 - LIMITED_SENSITIVE - This view provides information of the basic view along with the sensitive details of a card like true card number in plain text and expiry. 
 - EXPANDED_SENSITIVE- This view provides information of the expanded view along with the sensitive details of a card like true card number in plain text, expiry, and CVV.

CardConfigType.description: This is the type of card configuration.

CardConfigStatus.description: This is the status of card configuration.

CardConfigValue.description: This is the value of card configuration.

ValidCardState.description: This is the status of the card.

MaskedPan.description: This is the actual card number which is masked to avoid data theft. For example, only the first six and last four digits of the card are shown.

CardLifecycleActionType.description: This contains issuance type of the card. It indicates if the card is replaced, reissued, or renewed.

TransitionedTo.description: This is the global unique identifier (CGUID) of the replaced, renewed, or reissued card.

TransitionedAt.description: This is the date and time when a card was replaced, renewed, or reissued.

CardStatusReasonCode.description: This is the reason code to identify the status of the card. It contains the reason for changing card's state.

RelationshipType.description: This is the type of relationship between two cards.

CardRelationCreatedAt.description: This is the time when the add-on/virtual card was linked with the parent card.

BaseCardRelationshipRecord.description: This contains information about the parent card.

CardOperationRecordName.description: This is the name of a card operation. There can be many card operations under one card operation type.

CardOperationPerformedAt.description: This is the date and time when the card operation was performed.

CardOperationReasonDetail.description: This is the reason code for performing the card operation.

CardOperationDescriptionDetail.description: This is a short description of the reason for performing the card operation.

type.description: This specifies a stage in the issuance lifecycle of a card.

status.description: This is the current status of the issuance lifecycle.

additionalProperties.description: This contains additional information of the issuance lifecycle.

details.description: This contains additional information of the issuance lifecycle.

performedAt.description: This is the date and when an issuance lifecycle of a card was modified.

CardIssuanceStages.description: This contains a list of all the issuance lifecycle stages of a card.

BinRangeID.description: This is the unique identification code (ID) of the bin range to which the card belongs.

BaseInstrumentType.description: This is the Base Payment Instrument Type.

panSHA.description: This is the SHA of the PAN.

activationChannel.description: The channel through which the activation request was initiated.

DigitalCardActivatedAt.description: Time when digital card was activated.

PhysicalCardActivatedAt.description: Time when physical card was activated.

RelatedCards.description: This specifies a list of related cards.

targetURI.description: Identifier for the switch routing target

SwitchAttributes.description: This is the list of attributes (key-value pairs) associated with the switch. For cards dependent on primary card, targetURI will not be honoured.

targetURI.description: Identifier for the switch routing target

registerAtSwitch.description: Whether to register this card at the switch

SwitchAttributesForCreateCard.description: This is the list of attributes (key-value pairs) associated with the switch. For cards dependent on primary card, targetURI will not be honoured. registerAtSwitch is default to false.

CardVectors.description: This is the list of vectors associated with the card.

CardTags.description: This is the list of tags associated with the card.

CardNetwork.description: This is the name of the card network.

CardReferenceNumber.description: This is the unique card request number (CRN). A card request number is generated for each request obtained in a card order.

ResourceId.description: This is the unique identification code (ID) of the resource associated with the card.

Cguid.description: This is the global unique identifier of a card (CGUID).

CardSkuId.description: This is the unique identification code (ID) of the card’s stock keeping unit (SKU).

AccountHolderId.description: This is the unique identification code (ID) of the account holder.

CardId.description: This is the unique identification code (ID) of the card.

VectorsList.description: This is the list of vectors associated with a card. Must include at least one vector of type `ACCOUNTHOLDER`.

ClientRequestId.description: This is the requestID passed by client during issuance. This is the idempotency key for the request.

code.description: This is a code to identify the error.

message.description: This is a brief description of the error.

additionalProperties.description: This is the list of additional details associated with the error.

details.description: This is the list of additional details associated with the error.

debugId.description: This is the unique debug identifier (ID).

reference.description: This is the link to the error reference doc.

expiry.description: This is the new month and year in MM/YYYY format until which the card will be valid.

id.description: This is the unique ID of the wallet account.

additionalProperties.description: This is the list of additional attributes associated with the account.

attributes.description: This is the list of additional attributes associated with the account.

name.description: This is the name of the card recipient.

addressLine1.description: This is the first line of the account holder’s address such as PO Box, or company name.

addressLine2.description: This is the second line of the account holder’s address such as apartment, suite, unit, or building.

addressLine3.description: This is the third line of the account holder's address. It contains additional address details.

addressLine4.description: This is the fourth line of the account holder's address. It contains additional address details.

city.description: This is the city of the delivery address.

state.description: This is the state of the delivery address.

country.description: This is the country of the delivery address.

postalCode.description: This is the postal code of the delivery address.

contactNumber.description: This is the contact number of the card recipient.

cguid.description: This is the unique identifier of the base card.

BaseCardInfo.description: This is the information regarding the base card of an addon card.

bin.description: This is the bank identification number (BIN). It consists of the first six or eight digits of the card number. It is issued by the card network.

network.description: This is the name of a card network.

rangeID.description: This is the unique identification code (ID) of the bank identification number (BIN) range.

binLength.description: This denotes the character length of the bank identification number (BIN).

binType.description: This specifies the type of the card based on the bank identification number (BIN). For example, credit, debit.

CardBinRange.description: This contains the details of bank identification number (BIN) range of a card.

cardSkuId.description: This is the unique identification code (ID) of the card’s stock keeping unit (SKU).

productID.description: This is the unique identification code (ID) of the product.

ifi.description: This is the unique identification code of the issuing financial institution (IFI) or tenant.

plasticCode.description: This is the plastic code of the card. It determines the card design to be printed.

vendorID.description: This is the unique identification code (ID) of the card printing vendor.

tags.description: This is the list of tags associated with the card's stock keeping unit (SKU).

items.description: This is the list of tags associated with the card's stock keeping unit (SKU).

cardSkuGuid.description: This is the global unique identifier of the card's stock keeping unit (SKU).

cardGenerator.description: This is the name of the entity that generates the card. While one entity manages the card, there can be another that may issue it.

additionalProperties.description: This are additional attributes for the card SKU. Updates are not allowed (append only).

attributes.description: This are additional attributes for the card SKU. Updates are not allowed (append only).

supplementaryType.description: This is the supplementary type for the card SKU. Updates are not allowed.

vectors.description: This is a list of vectors associated with the card SKU. Updates are not allowed.

items.description: This is a list of vectors associated with the card SKU. Updates are not allowed.

CardSku.description: This contains the card’s stock keeping unit (SKU) information.

startTimestamp.description: This is the start timestamp in ISO-8601 format, indicating when the card becomes effective and can be used for transactions.

endTimestamp.description: This is the end timestamp in ISO-8601 format, indicating when the card expires and can no longer be used for transactions. This has the highest priority over any expiry.

CardValidity.description: This contains the card validity details.

cardID.description: This is the unique identification code (ID) of the card.

cardHolderID.description: This is the unique identification code (ID) of the cardholder to whom the card belongs.

crn.description: This is the unique card request number. A card request number is generated for each request obtained in a card order

cardType.description: This specifies the type of card. It can be a physical or virtual.

maskedPan.description: This is the actual card number which is masked to avoid data theft. For example, only the first six and last four digits of the card are shown.

additionalProperties.description: This is a list of system level attributes for the card.

issuanceType.description: This is the type of issuance of the card.

serverPublicKey.description: This is the public key of the server.

encryptedData.description: This is the card PIN in encrypted format.

iv.description: This is the initialization vector. It’s an arbitrary number used along with a server public key to provide encrypted data. It generates an encrypted key by preventing a sequence of text that is identical to the previous sequence.

ECDHEncryptedCardPayload.description: This contains the attributes of the Elliptic-curve Diffie–Hellman (ECDH) encryption of a card.

EmptyClass.description:
This contains a list of configurations for a reservoir. A reservoir is a storage system where the CMS keeps pre-created cards associated with an SKU. It reduces the time it takes to associate a card with a user when a card request is received.

1. inventory.size - It determines the maximum number of pre-created cards that are available against the SKU in the reservoir.

2. refill.enabled - It determines whether to refill the reservoir or not.

3. refilling.rate - It determines the maximum number of cards that can be demanded for one refill cycle. One cycle is one iteration of publishing demand for the cards. A day consists of 24 cycles, and you have the flexibility to configure the number of cycles per day.

4. issuances.enabled - It determines whether the cards are to be issued from the reservoir or not.

5. reservoir.enabled - It determines whether the reservoir is enabled or not for the SKU

Expiry.description: This is the date until when the card is valid. The date follows the MMYY format, where M stands for month and Y stands for year. This information will be printed on the card.

view.name: view
view.description:
This is the view of the response record. It can be any one of the following views: 
 - BASIC - This view provides basic information about the card like card ID, masked Primary Account Number (PAN) of the card, status, etc. 
 - EXPANDED - This view provides information of the basic view and extra information about the card order. 
 - LIMITED_SENSITIVE - This view provides information of the basic view along with the sensitive details of a card like true card number in plain text and expiry. 
 - EXPANDED_SENSITIVE- This view provides information of the expanded view along with the sensitive details of a card like true card number in plain text, expiry, and CVV.

getBasicCardDetails.description: This view will return basic details of a card

getBasicCardAndOrderDetails.description: This view will return basic and order details of a card

getLimitedSensitiveCardDetails.description: This view will return all details of card except cvv if applicable.

getAllCardDetails.description: This view will return all details of a card

primaryCguidPathParam.name: cguid
primaryCguidPathParam.description: This is the global unique identifier of primary card (CGUID).

limit.name: limit
limit.description: This specifies the limit to the maximum number of records that can be displayed in the response.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: This specifies the starting point within a list of entries from which records should be selected or retrieved.

operationType.name: operationType
operationType.description: This specifies the type of operation for which the response is requested.
